title: Teenager sets world records for longest legs
description: A 17-year-old named Maci Currin has set two Guinness World Records for having the longest legs.

title: Confirmation hearing for Amy Coney Barrett begins in Senate
description: With Election Day just weeks away, a bitterly divided Senate on Monday launched the confirmation hearing of Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Donald Trump's choice to fill the seat of the late liberal icon, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

title: Why thousands are signing up to be exposed to Covid-19
Microsoft takes down massive hacking operation that could have affected the election
Trump takes his Covid misinformation machine back on the road
Tourist returns stolen artifacts to Pompeii after suffering 'curse' for 15 years
description: A Canadian woman has returned five artifacts she took from Pompeii in 2005, saying they have plagued her with bad luck.

title: A Colorado wildfire jumped a highway and is now burning on an Army base
description: Firefighters are battling a wildfire on a Colorado Army base.

title: If confirmed, Trump's Supreme Court choice will fill the seat of late liberal icon Ruth Bader Ginsburg
Belarus allows police to use lethal weapons at mass anti-government protests
description: Security forces in Belarus detained dozens of protesters on Sunday and used force, including water cannon and batons, to break up crowds demanding a new presidential election, TV footage showed.

title: Jennifer Aniston introduces adorable rescue puppy, Lord Chesterfield
description: Jennifer Aniston is in love.

title: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott suffers devastating injury
description: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott left the field on a cart choking back tears as he raised a fist to the fans in attendance at the AT&T Stadium, after suffering a horrific injury during a Sunday NFL game against NFC East opponents the New York Giants.

title: Astronomers witness 'spaghettification' of star shredded by a black hole
description: A black hole enjoyed one stellar spaghetti dinner and astronomers were able to witness the event from 215 million light-years away in a spiral galaxy in the Eridanus constellation.

title: Breonna Taylor grand juror responds to Kentucky AG's request to prevent juror from publicly speaking until after state appeal
description: The attorney for an anonymous grand juror in the Breonna Taylor case filed a reply Sunday to the Kentucky attorney general's request for a stay of any court order allowing the juror to speak out publicly until after a potential state appeal.

title: How LeBron James stacks up against basketball's greats
description: It's the perennial question. Who is better, Wilt Chamberlain or Bill Russell? Kareem Abdul-Jabbar or Larry Bird? Magic Johnson or Michael Jordan?

title: Magnus Carlsen's 125-game unbeaten streak ended
description: All good things must come to an end, and so it was that Magnus Carlsen's record-breaking streak without defeat in classical chess was halted by Jan-Krzysztof Duda on Saturday.

title: Premier League's future up for grabs as 'Project Big Picture' comes into view
description: Buffeted by a global pandemic, the future of the English Premier League -- whose 20 clubs in 2018/19 delivered total revenue of over $6.5 billion for the first time in his history -- appears to be up for grabs.

title: The new app encouraging us to spread positivity via 'love taps'
description: We could all do with a little more positive human connection these days. At least that's what the folks behind design company Frosty Pop think -- and they have decided to do something about it.

title: Analysis: Trump takes his Covid misinformation machine on the road
description: Trump plans to hold his first rally since his virus diagnosis was publicly disclosed, in Florida, in what risks turning into yet another super spreader event

title: Inside a small-town Native American beauty pageant
description: Each year, pageants like Miss Native American and Miss Indian World invite indigenous women from around the United States to represent historically disenfranchised tribes and celebrate their cultural heritage.

title: Kim Jong Un gets emotional over Covid efforts
description: Kim Jong Un choked up before praising North Korea's "anti-epidemic" efforts and unveiling a new ballistic missile. Neither Kim, nor any crowd members appeared to be wearing masks.

title: Who is Amy Coney Barrett?
description: President Donald Trump has nominated Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court. Here's where she stands on the law, her faith, and Roe v. Wade.

title: Airbus has a plane with flapping wingtips -- and they just got even longer
description: Since the dawn of aviation, birds have been an inspiration for visionaries of flight. And now, engineers are once again looking to feathered friends to inspire the next generation of aircraft wings.

title: US economists share Nobel for work in auction theory
description: American economists Paul Milgrom and Robert Wilson have been awarded the 2020 Nobel Prize in economics for their contributions to auction theory, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.

title: Why thousands are signing up to be exposed to Covid-19
'Goldfinger' actress Margaret Nolan dead at 76
description: Margaret Nolan, an actress and model who famously featured covered in gold paint in the title sequence for the James Bond movie "Goldfinger," has died at the age of 76.

title: Pope meets Cardinal George Pell for first time since return to Rome
description: Pope Francis met with Cardinal George Pell at the Vatican on Monday in their first meeting since Pell's return to Rome late last month following his acquittal on child sex abuse charges in his native Australia.

title: Australian Prime Minister's car vandalized by protesters
description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison was targeted with tomatoes and fake blood, and his car was vandalized by protesters during a visit to the University of Queensland on Monday, CNN affiliates 9 News and 7 News reported.

title: Police use water cannons against protesters in Nigeria
description: Nigeria's Special Anti-Robbery Squad, a controversial police unit accused of brutality, will be disbanded following nationwide protests demanding an end to police violence in the country. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports.

title: What Trump could learn from the fall of France's own fiery 'law and order' president
description: Americans are on the eve of a momentous political choice this November. But for a jump on how the story goes from here, consider what happened in France, where another "back to normal" candidate challenged a firebrand incumbent.

title: The American man who became a porter on Everest
description: It might not seem that way when you read harrowing accounts of climbers perishing on its treacherous slopes, but there's an easy way to climb Everest, and there's a hard way.

title: Sei Young Kim wins first major at Women's PGA Championship
description: Sei Young Kim claimed the first major title of her career at the Women's PGA Championship with a record-equaling final round 63.

title: See inside Qantas' 'flight to nowhere' around Australia
description: A flight to nowhere took off from Sydney, Australia, and returned to Sydney. Die-hard travelers eager to get on a plane boarded the flight that looped around the country, with views including Uluru and the Great Barrier Reef. CNN's Kim Brunhuber reports.

title: The Wanted singer Tom Parker reveals he has inoperable brain tumor
description: Tom Parker, a British singer who spent five years as part of the popular boy band The Wanted, has revealed he has an inoperable brain tumor.

title: Anti-lockdown protests across Europe despite surge in cases
description: As Covid-19 cases rise in Europe, protests against government restrictions and lockdowns are popping up across the continent. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: This rare 'peacock' star system in our galaxy is doomed to explode
description: A rare star system has been found in our Milky Way galaxy, but it's doomed to end in a massive explosion.

title: Ursula Andress' iconic 'Dr. No' bikini could fetch $500K at auction
description: Remember when the statuesque Bond girl Honey Ryder emerged from the Caribbean Sea in a white bikini?

title: How America's schools have started the new year in the pandemic
description: Initial data from Brown University suggests the spread of coronavirus in schools may not be as rampant as feared. But not everyone is ready to go back to in-person learning. CNN's Bianna Golodryga reports.

title: Analysis: How wrestling explains Trump's 'Superman' stunt
description: This paragraph, from The New York Times, might at first shock you:

title: Video shows unmanned boat flying into air before crash
description: Three men reportedly doing a photo shoot on a boat in Florida somehow fell overboard, leaving the vessel unmanned and out of control before it hit two docks near the coastline.
